quote: "Ibrahim Adil Shah, who ascended the throne in Bijapur, the Deccan, in 942/1535-36, is reported to have proclaimed Hindavi (in this case Marathi) as the language of his government, entrusting all the important administrative and financial offices to the Brahmans."
religion: Shia Islam (1490-1552) Salma Ahmed Farooqui, ''A Comprehensive History of Medieval India: From Twelfth to the Mid-Eighteenth Century'', (Dorling Kindersley Pvt Ltd., 2011), 174.  ,  Sunni Islam (1552-1686)
